required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cervical Gland Area as a Predictor of Success of Labour Induction
clinical_study.official_title: Cervical Gland Area as a Predictor of Success of Labour Induction

brief_summary.textblock: Women who fulfil the inclusion criteria and who are planned for labour induction will be recruited. Bishop score, cervical length, and the presence of cervical glandular area (CGA) will be documented for every patient up to 12 hours prior to the induction process, and patient information and maternal and neonatal outcome will be documented following the delivery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patient consent to participate in the study will be retrieved following the medical decision of labor induction and the mode of induction and following the patient consent to the induction.
Bishop score, cervical length, and the presence of cervical glandular area (CGA) will be documented for every patient up to 12 hours prior to the induction process.
The method of induction, data regarding patient demographics, the progress of labor, and the maternal and neonatal outcome will be documented following the delivery.

primary_outcome.description: Percent of patients that reached the active stage of labour (defined as measurement of cervical dilation of greater than 6 cm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Induction to second stage
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of time from initiation of labpur induction to cervical dilation of 10cm
Duration of time from initiation of labpur induction to delivery
The rate of patient that deliver vaginally including instrumental deliverires
The fetal arterial pH measuerment following the delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal outcome - APGAR (Apearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration score)
secondary_outcome.description: The fetal APGAR score as recieved by pediatrician

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal outcome - NICU (Neonatal Intensive Care Unit) admission
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of neonated that requiered NICU admission

intervention.description: Women that are planned for labour induction, will undergo a routine ultrasound examination prior to the initiation of the induction process.

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women who are planned form labour induction

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton and twins' pregnancies
- Pregnancy 34-41 weeks of gestation
- Vertex presentation
- Induction methods (Oxytocin, prostaglandin 1 (PGE1), prostaglandin 2 (PGE2), double balloon catheter, rupture of memebrane (ROM)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intrauterine fetal demise (IUFD)
- Contraindication to vaginal delivery
- Status post cervical cerclage
- Previous attempt of labor induction
- History of cervical surgery
- Active vaginal bleeding
